headline: ‘A WIN FOR THE FIRST AMENDMENT’: Jordan Says Musk Buying Twitter Would Be ‘Tremendous’
author: The First
sentences:
So I’m interested to see how this plays out, but I hope it goes forward and we get a place where you can actually have the First Amendment be the First Amendment.”
The Twitter board has not agreed to Musk’s proposal, instead opting to take “the poison pill,” diluting shares and making a takeover much more difficult for Musk.

Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) spoke with Fox News’ Jimmy Failla about billionaire Elon Musk’s bid to buy Twitter; Jordan is a big fan of the move, saying “I hope it goes through.”
“I think this is tremendous.
And finally, some pushback because for so long, the Left says, if you don’t agree with me, you’re not even allowed to speak.
The fiduciary responsibility they have, the stock price is going up I think like 16, 17 bucks with what he’s doing.
And someone with resources like Elon Musk is saying, forget that, I’m just going to try to buy you guys.
And if you try, we’re going to call you a racist and we’re going to cancel you.
Last week during a TED Talk interview, Musk did confirm that he has a “plan B.”
I hope it goes through, and we’ll see what these people do.
If they don’t do that, I mean, that’s serious.
And the country has said, forget that noise.
